DOC.brief_summary: To evaluate the additive value of tadalafil given together with Diamox (acetazolamide) in preventing acute mountain sickness in travelers to high altitude areas.
DOC.brief_title: Tadalafil and Acetazolamide Versus Acetazolamide in Acute Mountain Sickness Prevention
DOC.detailed_description: A randomized controlled study comparing: Tadalafil [20mg x1/day] and acetazolamide [125mg x2 day], versus Acetazolamide [125mg x2 day] alone, in trekkers to altitude > 3,000 m.
DOC.criteria: Participant in trekking to high altitude Agreement to sign the informed consent. No agreement to sign informed consent.
DOC.keyword: Acute Mountain Sickness assessed by Lake Louise score
